Good fences make good neighbors remarks this early neighbor and the Robert Frost poem mending wall
Boundaries and borders categories in classes seem to be an inescapable part of today's world
We build fences to keep some things in and other things out often with mixed results fences both figuratively and literally can help and hurt protect and hinder
So what does it make good neighbors
In geopolitics or international relations
That may be a complicated question but when we're talking about people in neighborhoods
Perhaps it's a bit simpler it's been said that the kind of neighbor we are reveals a lot about what kind of people we are if we can be compassionate generous and trustworthy toward the people next door even if there are different from us
Then we're more likely to be that way with others we meet or we friendly and welcoming or we open to new people and big hearted in our interactions are we respectful and tolerant of other people
Their property reputations and personalities are we the kind of neighbors we would like to have [noise] years ago to families moved into two different neighborhoods in the same city one family was welcomed warmly with Lowes handshakes and friendly visit
The other family felt unnoticed an unwelcome with hardly a greeting from anyone people seem to talk about them instead of with them some might argue that the newcomers have a responsibility to reach out and introduce themselves to people in the neighborhood
Surely neighborly and this is a shared responsibility but let us never forget what it feels like to be the new person
To worry that you won't fit in to wonder if people will accept you it's not easy to move into a new and unfamiliar neighborhood
Just as it's not easy to step out of our comfort zone and befriend people we don't know but that's the first step toward being good neighbors and defenses are still needed perhaps they can be the kind with gates and welcoming walkways
That allow for positive and friendly interactions after all in reality it's good people not good fences
That make good neighbors
